page.title: 01General Description
page.content: Until the late 19th century the area covered in this project was used as farmland.Along with beef and dairy cattle the cereal crops of wheat,oats and barley along with potatoes and turnips were grown on the farms that averaged some 100 acres per farm.Only two farms are in the section now,Warren House farm and Blackhills Farm. The southern part of the project area is dominated by the seaward end of{Castle Eden Dene.}The dene is the largest dene on the Permian plateau of East Durham.The denes were cut by the melting water at the end of the last glacial period.As the volume of water decreased then the rock and soil carried by the vast amounts of meltwater were deposited leaving the denes at their present size.The dene is now a nature reserve
